page.title: 04FARM BUILDINGS CLOWNE
page.content: THE OLDEST PART OF THE FARM IS MADE UP OF THE STONE BUILT FARM WITH A BARN AND COWSHEDS SURROUNDING AN ENCLOSED FARMYARD.THE COWSHEDS ON ONE SIDE OF THE FARMYARD BEING USED TO KEEP THE YOUNG HEIFER CALVES IN.IN THE COWSHEDS ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE IS THE MILKING PARLOUR WHERE THE COWS CAN BE MILKED 5 AT A TIME.IN A LOOSE BOX THE 8 MONTH OLD BULL IS KEPT.THE BARN IS DIVIDED INTO 2 STOREYS AT ONE END.ON THE LOWER LEVEL MACHINERY IS STORED,ABOVE THIS IS THE MILL FOR MILLING THE BARLEY.IN THE REST OF THE BARN IS A GRAIN SILO WHICH CAN HOLD 55-60 TONS OF BARLEY AND AN AREA WHERE NEWLY BORN CALVES ARE FIRST REARED AFTER BEING TAKEN AWAY FROM THEIR MOTHERS.
